basics.name: Kylie Cancilla
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying Data Science at the University of San Francisco, graduating May 2026.

interests.name: Conscientious Data Science for Sustainable Futures
Predictive Modeling for Disease Detection and Prevention
Statistical Methods for Personalized Medicine and Biomarker Discovery
Biomedical applications of Computer Vision Technology

publications.citation: K. Cancilla, A. Moore, A. Saini, C. Carrano. NovisVQ: A Streaming CNN for No-Reference Opinion-Unaware Frame Quality Assessment. arXiv preprint arxiv.org/abs/2511.04628 (November 2025).

A. Moore, A. Saini, K. Cancilla, D. Poland, C. Carrano. Training for X-Ray Vision: Amodal Segmentation and Amodal Content Completion from Multi-Camera Video. arXiv preprint arxiv.org/abs/2507.00339 (July 2025).

work.summary: Contributed to Computational Visual Perception Research
highlights: Developed NoVisIQ, a no-reference deep learning model that predicts LPIPS, PSNR, and SSIM from synthetically distorted images, supporting robust frame quality assessment.
Collaborated with other interns on the 2025 Data Science Challenge, implementing and benchmarking 3D U-Net and Diffusion-VAS models for amodal video content completion.

Iteratively enhanced the model from an image-based to streaming-based architecture (NoVisVQ), substantially improving prediction accuracy with up to 84.7% MAE reduction across quality metrics and strong correlations to ground truth. Published comparative analysis on arXiv (November 2025).

work.summary: Assisted in organizing the 2025 Women in Data Science (WiDS) annual datathon.
highlights: Developed a Jupyter Notebook and led workshops for 100+ participants to predict ADHD in adolescent girls using socio-demographic, parenting and connectome data. Guided data exploration, cleaning, and multi-output machine learning model development for ADHD diagnosis and patient sex prediction.

work.company: University of San Francisco Math/Data Science Department
